page.title: 07EDUCATION CONTINUED
page.content: AKELEY WOOD has 400 fee-paying day school children, 4 - 16 years. The Tudor style building is set in 22 acres of park and woodland. 33 staff teach classes of 20 English, maths, sciences, languages, domestic science, history, geography, art, com- puter studies, games, swimming, re- ligion. After taking O' levels or CSE, they transfer to public school or sixth form to take A' levels. There are many after school clubs. Coaches bring pupils in from surrounding area. CHARMANDEAN BOARDING SCHOOL in 12 acres of park and woodland, accommoda- ting 118 girls, aged 8 - 18 with 23 teachers. Run on similar line to Akeley Wood, but with more outside visits to local church etc. Senior girls work for Duke of Edinburgh Award Scheme.
